skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Professional brand consistency enforcement and corporate identity management with support for color palettes, typography, logo usage, tone of voice, and multi-channel brand application. Use for: (1) Creating brand style guides, (2) Enforcing brand consistency across documents, (3) Logo usage validation, (4) Typography standards, (5) Color palette management, (6) Brand voice guidelines
skill.summary: Professional brand consistency enforcement and corporate identity management with support for color ...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown and JSON files with brand guideline content. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system operations. The skill provides templates, specifications, and best practices for brand management.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to maintain consistent branding across documents, websites, and marketing materials. This skill provides comprehensive templates and specifications for logo usage, color palettes, typography, and brand voice to ensure professional, cohesive brand identity.
actual_capabilities: Create comprehensive brand guidelines documents from templates
Define logo usage rules including clear space, minimum sizes, and prohibited alterations
Establish color palettes with WCAG accessibility compliance for all combinations
Design typography systems with hierarchy, weights, and spacing specifications
Develop brand voice guidelines with tone adaptations for different contexts
Apply brand standards across digital, print, and marketing applications
limitations: Does not generate actual design files or images
Does not create brand assets or logo files
Does not validate existing materials against guidelines
Does not provide legal advice or trademark guidance

use_cases.title: Create Brand Guides
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive brand guideline documents for internal teams and external partners to ensure consistent visual identity.

use_cases.title: Apply Brand Standards
use_cases.description: Reference specifications for logo placement, color values, typography hierarchy, and spacing when designing materials.

use_cases.title: Maintain Brand Voice
use_cases.description: Apply consistent tone and messaging across website copy, social media posts, and marketing communications.

prompt_templates.title: New Brand Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Create comprehensive brand guidelines for [Company Name] including: primary and secondary brand colors with hex codes and accessibility ratings, typography system with font families and hierarchy, logo usage rules with clear space requirements, and brand voice characteristics for different contexts.

prompt_templates.title: Color Specifications
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a complete color palette for [Brand] including primary, secondary, accent, and neutral colors. For each color provide HEX, RGB, CMYK, and Pantone values. Test all text/background combinations for WCAG AA compliance and document which combinations are approved.

prompt_templates.title: Logo Rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create logo usage guidelines including: minimum clear space requirements expressed as X-height, minimum print and digital sizes, approved color variations, and list of prohibited alterations like stretching, rotating, or adding effects.

prompt_templates.title: Voice Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop brand voice guidelines for [Company] including core voice characteristics, tone adaptations for customer support, marketing, technical documentation, and social media, along with before and after examples showing off-brand versus on-brand copy.

output_examples.input: Create brand guidelines for a tech startup called TechFlow Solutions
output: TechFlow Blue (#1E40AF) as primary color with AAA accessibility on white backgrounds
Inter for headings and Merriweather for body text with complete type scale from 12px to 72px
Logo requires X-height clear space on all sides, minimum 150px width digitally
Voice: Professional yet approachable, confident but not arrogant

best_practices: Always test color combinations for WCAG accessibility before finalizing palettes
Use locked templates to protect brand elements from accidental modification
Schedule regular brand audits to maintain consistency across materials
Provide multiple guideline versions for different user needs
anti_patterns: Using approximate color values instead of exact brand colors
Applying logo without maintaining required clear space
Mixing font families beyond the approved primary and secondary typefaces
Ignoring WCAG contrast requirements for text and background combinations

faq.question: Does this skill create actual logo or design files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation and specifications. You will need design software like Figma, Illustrator, or Canva to create actual visual assets based on the guidelines.

faq.question: What color formats are supported?
faq.answer: All major formats including HEX, RGB, CMYK, HSL, and Pantone (where applicable). The skill documents each format for implementation across web, print, and digital applications.

faq.question: Can I use this with my existing brand assets?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill helps document and organize your existing brand elements into comprehensive guidelines. It works with any brand regardless of current maturity level.

faq.question: Is my brand data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill processes information locally within the AI conversation. No brand data is stored externally or shared. All specifications remain confidential.

faq.question: How do I validate materials against guidelines?
faq.answer: Use the checklist approach documented in the skill. Review each element (logo, colors, typography, voice) against the documented specifications. The skill includes detailed audit checklists for this purpose.

faq.question: How is this different from a design system?
faq.answer: Brand guidelines define identity standards (colors, logos, voice). Design systems implement those standards as reusable components and patterns. This skill focuses on the foundational brand documentation layer.
